entry.title: The National Assembly for Wales (Legislative Competence) (Education) Order 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The National Assembly for Wales (Legislative Competence) (Education) Order 2010

entry.summary: This Order amends the Government of Wales Act 2006 (“the 2006 Act”). The Order extends the legislative competence of the National Assembly for Wales to make laws known as Measures of the National Assembly for Wales (referred to in the 2006 Act as “Assembly Measures”). It does this by adding new matters to the field of education and training contained within Schedule 5 to the 2006 Act. Subject to general limitations on the legislative competence of the National Assembly for Wales, which apply by virtue of section 94 of, and Schedule 5 to, the 2006 Act, an Assembly Measure may make provision that relates to the matters contained in the fields set out in Schedule 5 to the 2006 Act.

entry.title: The Department of Justice (2010 Act) (Commencement) Order (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: This Order provides for the coming into operation of the following provisions of the Department of Justice Act (Northern Ireland) 2010—

title.div: The National Health Service (Travelling Expenses and Remission of Charges) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2010 / Rheoliadau'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol (Treuliau Teithio a Pheidio â Chodi Tâl) (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2010

div.p: These Regulations, which apply in relation to Wales, further amend the National Health Service (Travel Expenses and Remission of Charges)(Wales) Regulations 2007 (“the principal Regulations”). Those Regulations provide for the payment of travel expenses and the remission of National Health Service charges for, amongst others, persons on low incomes, by reference to limits on their income and capital.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn gymwys o ran Cymru ac maent yn diwygio Rheoliadau'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol (Treuliau Teithio a Pheidio â Chodi Tâl) (Cymru) 2007 (“y prif Reoliadau”). Mae'r Rheoliadau hynny yn darparu am dalu treuliau teithio a pheidio â chodi taliadau'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol ar, ymhlith pobl eraill, bersonau sydd ar incwm isel, drwy gyfeirio at derfynau ar eu hincwm a'u cyfalaf.

entry.title: The Additional Support for Learning (Appropriate Agencies) (Scotland) Amendment Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order specifies that The Skills Development (Scotland) Co. Limited is an “appropriate agency” for the purpose of section23 of the Education (Additional Support for Learning) (Scotland) Act 2004 and removes that specification from Scottish Enterprise and Highlands and Islands Enterprise, which no longer carry out relevant functions.

entry.title: The Additional Support for Learning (Sources of Information) (Scotland) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order specifies persons from which parents of children having additional support needs and young persons having such needs can obtain advice, further information and support in relation to the provision for such needs, including such support and advocacy as is referred to in section 14 of the Education (Additional Support for Learning) (Scotland) Act 2004.

entry.title: The Additional Support for Learning Dispute Resolution (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Additional Support for Learning Dispute Resolution (Scotland) Regulations 2005 (“the principal Regulations”). The principal Regulations make provision under sections 16 and 34 of the Education (Additional Support for Learning) (Scotland) Act 2004 (asp 4) (“the 2004 Act”) for the resolution of disputes specified in the Schedule to the principal Regulations between an education authority and a parent of a child, a young person or, where the young person lacks capacity, their parent, concerning the exercise of the authority’s functions under the Act.

entry.title: The Criminal Procedure and Investigations Act 1996 (Code of Practice for Interviews of Witnesses Notified by Accused) Order 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Criminal Procedure and Investigations Act 1996 (Code of Practice for Interviews of Witnesses Notified by Accused) Order 2010

entry.summary: This Order brings into force a code of practice for arranging and conducting interviews of witnesses notified by accused persons (“the Code”). The Code is made under section 21A of the Criminal Procedure and Investigations Act 1996 (c. 25) (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Civil Aviation (Working Time) (Amendment) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Civil Aviation (Working Time) Regulations 2004 (S.I. 2004/756) (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Stipendiary Magistrates (Scotland) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order makes provision in connection with the Scottish Ministers’ powers in relation to the appointment of stipendiary magistrates under section74(1) of the Criminal Proceedings etc. (Reform) (Scotland) Act 2007.

entry.title: The Merchant Shipping (Ship-to-Ship Transfers) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations govern transfers consisting wholly or mainly of oil between ships, known as ship to ship transfers, within the seaward limits of the territorial sea of the United Kingdom.

entry.title: The Children Act 2004 Information Database (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Children Act 2004 Information Database (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2010

entry.summary: These Regulations are made under section 12 of the Children Act 2004 (“the Act”) and amend the Children Act 2004 Information Database (England) Regulations 2007 (“the ContactPoint Regulations”), which make provision in relation to the establishment and operation of the database known as “ContactPoint”. These Regulations come into force on the day after the day on which they are made.

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (Compensation) (No. 2) (England) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: Section 108 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 provides for the payment of compensation in certain cases where planning permission for development granted by a development order or a local development order is withdrawn and where on an application for planning permission for that development, the application is refused.

entry.title: The Charities (Disclosure of Revenue and Customs Information to the Charity Commission for Northern Ireland) Regulations 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Charities (Disclosure of Revenue and Customs Information to the Charity Commission for Northern Ireland) Regulations 2010

entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for the disclosure of Revenue and Customs information to the Charity Commission for Northern Ireland.

entry.title: The Damages-Based Agreements Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the requirements with which an agreement between a client and his or her representative must comply so as to enable it to be a damages-based agreement relating to an employment matter under section 58AA of the Courts and Legal Services Act 1990.

entry.title: The Pensions Act 2008 (Commencement No. 8) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order brings into force those parts of section 103(3) which insert section 46A(5) to (7) (retirement in tax year after 5th April 2020) into the Pension Schemes Act 1993 (c.48). Section 46A provides for a reduction in the amount of retirement pension or widowed parent’s allowance where a person is also entitled to a guaranteed minimum pension, where that person retires after 5th April 2020. Subsections (5), (6) and (7) of that section provide that the Secretary of State must require the Government Actuary or the Deputy Government Actuary (‘the Actuary’) to produce a report on how actuarial equivalence should be determined for the purposes of that section, that in preparing the report the Actuary consult such persons as the Actuary considers appropriate, and that the Secretary of State lay the report before Parliament.

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Liability of Issuers) Regulations 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Liability of Issuers) Regulations 2010

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the regime for the liability of issuers to third parties in respect of loss suffered as a result of misleading statements or dishonest omissions in information published by the issuer, or dishonest delays in publishing such information.

entry.title: The Jobseeker’s Allowance (Work for Your Benefit Pilot Scheme) Regulations 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Jobseeker’s Allowance (Work for Your Benefit Pilot Scheme) Regulations 2010

entry.summary: These Regulations establish a pilot scheme, known as the Work for Your Benefit Pilot Scheme, under the Jobseekers Act 1995 (“the Jobseekers Act”). They are made in reliance on the power to pilot regulations in section 29 of that Act. The Scheme, which is defined in regulation 2, is a scheme within section 17A(1) of the Jobseekers Act that is designed to assist jobseeker’s allowance claimants to obtain employment, including self-employment, and which includes for any individual work experience and job search.

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Amendments to Part 18A etc.) Regulations 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Amendments to Part 18A etc.) Regulations 2010

entry.summary: These Regulations continue the implementation of part of Directive 2004/39/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 April 2004 on markets in financial instruments (OJ No L 145, 30.4.2004, p.1) (“the Directive”). They amend Part 18A of the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (“the Act”), which transposed Articles 14.7, 41 and 50.2(j) and (k) of the Directive. A transposition note setting out how the main elements of the Directive, and the Community legislation adopted under it, have been given effect in UK law was set out as Annex A to the Explanatory Note to the Markets In Financial Instruments Directive (Consequential Amendments) Regulations 2007 (S.I. 2007/2932).

entry.title: The Al-Qaida and Taliban (Asset-Freezing) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to the enforcement of Council Regulation (E.C) No 881/2002 of 27 May 2002 (O.J. L 139, 29.5.2002, p.9) (“the Council Regulation”) which relate to restrictive measures directed at certain persons and entities associated with Usama bin Laden, the Al-Qaida network and the Taliban.

entry.title: The Medical Profession (Miscellaneous Amendments) Order 2008 (Commencement No. 3) Order of Council 2010
entry.summary: This Order appoints 30th April 2010 as the day on which certain provisions of the Medical Profession (Miscellaneous Amendments) Order 2008 (“the 2008 Order”) are to come into force. These provisions amend the Medical Act 1983 and relate to the disclosure of information obtained by a licensing authority about a medical practitioner during a revalidation pilot scheme, and the use of such information in investigation proceedings. Paragraph 13 of Schedule 1, Part 2 of the 2008 Order inserts section 29EA into the Medical Act 1983; and paragraph 17 of that Part amends section 35C of the Act.
